description:
UMD 3.8.1 is an emergency release in order to make available to the EGI production 
infrastructure the classads and xerces-c packages removed from EPEL repositories. This release contains support for Scientific Linux 5
 and 6.
releaseNotes:
This release contains the following pracakges:<br><br>classADS, v. 1.0.8:<br><ul><li>this update makes available in UMD repositories the v. 1.0.8, retired from the EPEL 5 &amp; 6 repositories, while waiting for the long-term solution, their un-retirement in EPEL.</li></ul><p>xerces-c, v. 2.7.0-8:</p><ul><li>this update makes available in UMD repositories the v. 2.7.0-8, retired from the EPEL 5 repositories, while waiting for the 
long-term solution, their un-retirement in EPEL.</li></ul>
installationNotes: Installation and configuration notes are available in the <a href="http://repository.egi.eu/category/umd_releases/distribution/umd-3/">EGI repository.</a>
contact:
For further information about the UMD, its goals and surrounding processes, and
more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please
send an Email to: cto (at) egi.eu.
technicalContact: For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release <br>notes of this UMD release, or the related documentation provided by the <br>Technology Providers, please visit the <a href="https://ggus.eu/">EGI Helpdesk</a> to make a report.
knownIssues: Details containing known issues and workarounds found in EGI verification and <br>staged rollout are collected in:<br><a href="https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-3:UMD-3.8.1">https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-3:UMD-3.8.1</a>
changeLog: This release includes updates for the following packages:<br><ul><li>classads-*&nbsp;</li><li>xerces-c-*<br></li></ul>
